title: I lost LP from a /remake game?

embed.description: UPDATE: /Remake rules were updated after testing on PBE. This article now lists the correct rules. Even if the occasional stomp feels great, every game of League should feel hard-fought and competitive on both sides.

body:
As stated in the title, I just lost 19 LP from a game that we remade.

Our Sejuani forgot smite, so she quit the game to let us all remake. I was not in queue with Sejuani, yet I lost LP. As Riot stated in their update on remakes:

>All players connected to the game basically pretend the game never happened, gaining or losing no LP/IP/XP, and seeing no change to their overall W/L records

http://imgur.com/a/43lVW

replies.body: When a game is remade, anyone who is marked as AFK will receive the "leaver" penalty for a remake. It's not just for the initial player who disconnected. There are certain behaviors that will mark you as AFK even if you don't physically disconnect form the game, such as standing/running around in base. Doing that while waiting for a remake will mark you as AFK and give you the remake penalty.

Even if someone quits the game or doesn't initially, it's a good idea to continue to play the game normally in case they do actually come back before /Remake triggers. If everyone on a team goes AFK while waiting for a remake and someone comes back, it leaves the entire team behind, rather than just one player. 

*Zombiemaster* touched on some great points here as well. A lot of the info on this system can be found on our [/Remake FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/208754686--Remake-FAQ). Let me know if you have any additional questions.
